member.name: T:UsbUirt.TransmitState

member.name: T:UsbUirt.Controller
member.summary: Provides a managed wrapper around the USB-UIRT driver.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new UsbUirt Controller.
member.remarks: In order to ensure that the connection with the USBUirt device is closed, you must call Dispose() when you are done with object.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Finalize
member.summary: If the author forgets to call Dispose, free unmanaged resources at finalization.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all managed and unmanaged resources held by this object.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Transmit(System.String)
member.summary: Transmits an IR code synchronously using the default code format.
member.param: The IR code to transmit.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Transmit(System.String,UsbUirt.CodeFormat,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Transmits an IR code synchronously.
member.param: The IR code to transmit.
The format of the IR code.
Indicates how many iterations of the code should be sent (in the case of a 2-piece code, the first stream is sent once followed by the second stream sent repeatCount times).
Time in milliseconds since the last received IR activity to wait before sending an IR code. Normally, pass 0 for this parameter.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.TransmitAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Transmits an IR code asynchronously using the default code format.
member.param: The IR code to transmit.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.TransmitAsync(System.String,UsbUirt.CodeFormat,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Transmits an IR code asynchronously.
member.param: The IR code to transmit.
The format of the IR code.
Indicates how many iterations of the code should be sent (in the case of a 2-piece code, the first stream is sent once followed by the second stream sent repeatCount times).
Time in milliseconds since the last received IR activity to wait before sending an IR code. Normally, pass 0 for this parameter.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.TransmitAsync(System.String,UsbUirt.CodeFormat,System.Int32,System.TimeSpan,System.Object)
member.summary: Transmits an IR code asynchronously.
member.param: The IR code to transmit.
The format of the IR code.
Indicates how many iterations of the code should be sent (in the case of a 2-piece code, the first stream is sent once followed by the second stream sent repeatCount times).
Time in milliseconds since the last received IR activity to wait before sending an IR code. Normally, pass 0 for this parameter.
An optional user state object that will be passed to the TransmitCompleted event.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Learn
member.summary: Learns an IR code synchronously using the default code format.
member.returns: The IR code that was learned, or null if learning failed.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Learn(UsbUirt.CodeFormat)
member.summary: Learns an IR code synchronously.
member.param: The format of the IR code to use in learning.
member.returns: The IR code that was learned, or null if learning failed.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Learn(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Learns an IR code synchronously using the default code format.
member.param: The timeout after which to abort learning if it has not completed.
member.returns: The IR code that was learned, or null if learning failed.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Learn(UsbUirt.CodeFormat,UsbUirt.LearnCodeModifier,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Learns an IR code synchronously.
member.param: The format of the IR code to use in learning.
The modifier used for the code format.
The timeout after which to abort learning if it has not completed.
member.returns: The IR code that was learned, or null if learning failed.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.Learn(UsbUirt.CodeFormat,UsbUirt.LearnCodeModifier,System.UInt32,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Learns an IR code synchronously.
member.param: The format of the IR code to use in learning.
The modifier used for the code format.
The frequency to use in learning.
The timeout after which to abort learning if it has not completed.
member.returns: The IR code that was learned, or null if learning failed.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.LearnAsync
member.summary: Learns an IR code asynchronously using the default code format.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.LearnAsync(UsbUirt.CodeFormat)
member.summary: Learns an IR code asynchronously.
member.param: The format of the IR code to use in learning.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.LearnAsync(UsbUirt.CodeFormat,UsbUirt.LearnCodeModifier,System.Object)
member.summary: Learns an IR code asynchronously.
member.param: The format of the IR code to use in learning.
The modifier used for the code format.
An optional user state object that will be passed to the Learning and LearnCompleted events and which can be used when calling LearnAsyncCancel().

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.LearnAsync(UsbUirt.CodeFormat,UsbUirt.LearnCodeModifier,System.UInt32,System.Object)
member.summary: Learns an IR code asynchronously.
member.param: The format of the IR code to use in learning.
The modifier used for the code format.
The frequency to use in learning.
An optional user state object that will be passed to the Learning and LearnCompleted events and which can be used when calling LearnAsyncCancel().

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.LearnAsyncCancel
member.summary: Cancels a LearnAsync() operation.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.LearnAsyncCancel(System.Object)
member.summary: Cancels a LearnAsync() operation that was passed the specified userState.
member.param: The optional userState object passed to LearnAsync().

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTOpen
member.summary: Opens communication with the USB-UIRT. A call to UUIRTOpen should occur prior to any other driver function calls (with the exception of UUIRTGetDrvInfo below).
member.returns: On success, a handle to be used in subsequent calls to USB-UIRT functions. On failure, INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTClose(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Terminates communication with the USB-UIRT. Should be called prior to terminating host program.
member.param: Handle to to USB-UIRT returned by UUIRTOpen

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTGetDrvInfo(System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the driver (not the hardware itself). This is intended to allow version control on the .DLL driver and accomodate future changes and enhancements to the API.
member.remarks: This call may be called prior to a call to UUIRTOpen.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTGetUUIRTInfo(System.IntPtr,UsbUirt.Controller.UUINFO@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the UUIRT hardware.
member.param: Handle to to USB-UIRT returned by UUIRTOpen
UUINFO structure that will be filled in upon success

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTGetUUIRTConfig(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the current feature configuration bits from the USB-UIRT's nonvolatile configuration memory. These various configuration bits control how the USB-UIRT behaves. Most are reserved for future implementation and should be read and written as Zero.
member.param: Handle to to USB-UIRT returned by UUIRTOpen
Integer representation of USB-UIRT configuration
member.remarks: Using this API call is optional and is only needed to support changing USB-UIRT's private preferences

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTSetUUIRTConfig(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Configures the current feature configuration bits for the USB-UIRT's nonvolatile configuration memory. These various configuration bits control how the USB-UIRT behaves.
member.param: Handle to to USB-UIRT returned by UUIRTOpen
Integer representation of USB-UIRT configuration

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTTransmitIR(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Transmits an IR code via the USB-UIRT hardware.
member.param: Handle to to USB-UIRT returned by UUIRTOpen
null-terminated string
format specifier which identifies the format of the IRCode code. Currently, supported formats are Compressed_UIRT (STRUCT), RAW, and Pronto-RAW
indicates how many iterations of the code should be sent (in the case of a 2-piece code, the first stream is sent once followed by the second stream sent repeatCount times)
time in milliseconds since the last received IR activity to wait before sending an IR code -- normally pass 0 for this parameter

optional event handle which is obtained by a call to CreateEvent. If hEvent is NULL, the call to UUIRTTransmitIR will block and not return until the IR code has been fully transmitted to the air. If hEvent is not NULL, it must be a valid Windows event hande. In this case, UUIRTTransmitIR will return immediately and when the IR stream has completed transmission this event will be signalled by the driver
reserved for future expansion; should be NULL
reserved for future expansion; should be NULL

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTLearnIR(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Text.StringBuilder,UsbUirt.Controller.LearnCallback,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Instructs the USB-UIRT and the API to learn an IR code.
member.param: Handle to to USB-UIRT returned by UUIRTOpen
format specifier which identifies the format of the IRCode code to learn. Currently, supported formats are Compressed_UIRT (STRUCT), RAW, and Pronto-RAW
the learned IR code (upon return). It is the responsibility of the caller to allocate space for this string; suggested string size is at least 2048 bytes

a caller-supplied callback function which will be called periodically during the learn process and may be used to update user dialogs, etc. Information passed to the callback are learn progress %, signal quality, and carrier frequency.
will be passed by the USB-UIRT driver to any calls of progressProc.

pointer to a Boolean variable which should be initialized to FALSE (0) prior to the call. Setting this variable TRUE during the learn process will cause the UUIRTLearnIR process to abort and the function to return. Since the UUIRTLearnIR function will block for the duration of the learn process, one could set the *pAbort to TRUE either within the callback function or from another thread
currently used only when the codeFormat includes the UUIRTDRV_IRFMT_LEARN_FORCEFREQ flag (not normally needed) -- in which case param1 should indicate the forced carrier frequency
reserved for future expansion; should be NULL
reserved for future expansion; should be NULL
member.remarks: The IR code learned will be a complete IR stream suitable for subsequent transmission via UUIRTTransmitIR. Consequently, the same formats supported by Transmit are also available for learn. It is recommended to use either RAW or Pronto-RAW codeFormat to offer the best compatibility; compressed-UIRT format is often too limiting, although it does produce the smallest codes.

member.name: M:UsbUirt.Controller.UUIRTSetReceiveCallback(System.IntPtr,UsbUirt.Controller.ReceiveCallback,System.IntPtr)
member.summary:
Registers a receive callback function which the driver will call when an IR code is received from the air.
typedef void (WINAPI *PUUCALLBACKPROC) (char *IREventStr, void *userData); When the USB-UIRT receives a code from the air, it will call the callback function with a null-terminated, twelve-character (like IRMAN) ir code in IREventStr.
member.remarks: The types of codes which are passed to IREventStr are not the same as the type of codes passed back from a UUIRTLearnIR call (the codes from a UUIRTLearnIR are much larger and contain all the necessary data to reproduce a code, whereas the codes passed to IREventStr are simpler representations of IR codes only long enough to be unique).
member.param: Handle to to USB-UIRT returned by UUIRTOpen
the address of a PUUCALLBACKPROC function
a general-purpose 32-bit value supplied by the caller to UUIRTSetReceiveCallback. This parameter is useful for carrying context information, etc. Will be passed to receiveProc.

member.name: P:UsbUirt.Controller.GenerateLegacyCodesOnReceive
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the UsbUirt should generate legacy codes when IR is received.
member.value: True if the UsbUirt should generate legacy codes when IR is received.
